page.title: 01Eastern Ellesmere Port
page.content: This area is dominated by one industy,oil refining. Over half of the land in the area is occupied by the Stanlow Oil Refinery with the storage tanks, flare stacks, depots, and jetties associated with such a complex. The land here is the flat coastal strip of the Messey Estuary, at the confluence of the River Gowy. Stanlow Point, once a rocky outcrop is now an island being cut off from the mainland by the Manchester Ship Canal. To the west, and in the shadow of this heavily industrialised area is the werstern margin of Ellesmere Port town centre. A mixture of retail and residential and recreational areas make up this part of the town.
